pullRequest.title: Fix #245: Refactor RestRequestBuilderGenerator to accept arg file wit…
pullRequest.bodyText:
…h '@' syntax

Also add test coverage for psvm method

Gradle task refactor is still pending, but this gives @evanw555 a chance to start reviewing.

beforeCommit.message: Add Gradle task support for arg file generation

afterCommit.message: Add Gradle task support for arg file generation

nodes.bodyText: Is this basically just a copy of the existing test, but using PSVM instead? Would it be possible to keep this in the existing test class, or would that be too messy you think?

Although this logic is quite simple, it would probably be worthwhile to refactor this into its own utility class within :gradle-plugins, something like ArgumentFileBuilder (I say "___Builder" to stress that static utilities are unmaintainable) which handles creating the temp file and returning its "ID" (e.g. @/something/something). I think this would be a simple refactoring and would allow us to easily reuse it later, plus it removes complexity from this class.
Can you add a TODO here which says that we want to refactor this tool into a nicer CLI app using Commons-CLI?

Similar comment as the one above, there should be a utility class within :restli-tools which handles the parsing side of things. Although this logic here isn't too complicated, this will proactively keep this sort of stuff from exploding if we need to extend or reuse it, plus it keeps this class clean.

Since this utility is only accessible within the :gradle-plugins module, I think it's safe to let this method assume the temp dir to be Task#getTemporaryDir. This would make the code simpler from the caller's POV. What do you think?
Edit: Is it done this way because Gradle temp dirs are associated with a particular task?

+package com.linkedin.pegasus.gradle.internal;
+
+import org.gradle.api.GradleException;
+
+import java.io.File;
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.nio.file.Files;
+import java.util.List;
+
+public class ArgumentFileGenerator
+{
+
+  private ArgumentFileGenerator()
+  {
+    // prevent instantiation
+  }
+
+  /**
+   *  Helper method to generate an argument file, containing one input file per line.
+   *  This should be later prefixed with '@' and passed to the final argument of RestRequestBuilderGenerator.
+   *
+   * @param prefix unique value to prepend to the arg file name
+   * @param files the iterable to write to an arg file, one line per entry
+   * @param tempDir the directory to hold the file (If invoked from Gradle, use org.gradle.api.Task#getTemporaryDir()

nodes.bodyText: Calling this param files is confusing, since it doesn't refer to the arg file itself but rather to its inputs. I'd suggest renaming to args, entries, values, inputs, or something along those lines. In addition, we may reuse this utility later in a case where the args aren't necessarily filepaths.

+   limitations under the License.
+*/
+
+package com.linkedin.pegasus.gradle.internal;
+
+import org.gradle.api.GradleException;
+
+import java.io.File;
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.nio.file.Files;
+import java.util.List;
+
+public class ArgumentFileGenerator
+{
+
+  private ArgumentFileGenerator()
+  {
+    // prevent instantiation
+  }
+
+  /**
+   *  Helper method to generate an argument file, containing one input file per line.
+   *  This should be later prefixed with '@' and passed to the final argument of RestRequestBuilderGenerator.
+   *
+   * @param prefix unique value to prepend to the arg file name
+   * @param files the iterable to write to an arg file, one line per entry
+   * @param tempDir the directory to hold the file (If invoked from Gradle, use org.gradle.api.Task#getTemporaryDir()
+   * @return argument file which can be passed to a CLI or other JavaExec task
+   */
+  public static File createArgFile(String prefix, List<String> files, File tempDir)
